data.title: Map of Polish Composers
data.meta_description: Above all a distinguished organizer of musical life and conductor, Boleslaw Wallek-Walewski founded, among other ensembles, the Krakow Opera Society and the Echo men’s choir. He became famous as the author of a sequel to Halka, namely Jontek’s Revenge, but also has to his credit songs and choral works to words by Polish poets as well as folk melodies. His style was Romantic-Impressionist, not devoid of humor.
